Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: Kittalygirl
Reviews.Content: Reviews weren't great about this place but I liked it just fine. Staff weren't all super helpful although a couple of them were really nice. The playpen was set up in the room when we got there. Room was clean. Beds were very comfortable! Dolphin mall is nearby and the airport is close but I didn't hear any planes. I think it's best to get a car (we had one and got around fine). If I need more than one bedroom I think I'll most likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fair and a good value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fbrito29
Reviews.Content: This place delivers what any traveler would expect for the price, just a good night sleep. When we first checked in the person in the counter was courteous, as it is supposed to be, but never informed us of any of the amenities this hotel has. One of us had to sleep in the sofa bed, we had a small two bedroom suites, and when ask the front desk person if the maid would go up (while we were out having diner) to have the sofa bed ready, we were told that we would have to do it ourselves, the climax came when I was going to make it and realized then there was nothing for the sofa bed, so I had to come down to the front desk and request all the necessary things (pillow, bedsheets, etc). So, all travelers must understand that it is not an ***** Hotel, once that sinks in, everyone will realize it is a fair hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fair place, with minor drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: AncientMariner924
Reviews.Content: The hotel has undergone significant renovations, which has helped improve its offering. The exterior still looks old and in need of updating. It's nice to have a kitchen, but it's not perfect. The rooms are close and you may hear your neighbors. The staff is very helpful and will do what they can to help you out.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent place”
Reviews.Author: nick i
Reviews.Content: Not that bad as I read, depend on the apartment you got. I changed the room twice, and I discovered that there are different types of apartments, so if you are unhappy with your room, try to change it, you'll be surprised. The clerks are helpful and polite, the hotel is close to the Dolphin Mall and Int'l Mall and not far away from the Airport, around 20 min. The cons: the cleaning is so and so, the breakfast is the same every day, the pool is tiny, the area is surrounded by warehouses...

Reviews.Title: “Good and Enough”
Reviews.Author: JustineCarissa
Reviews.Content: The studio had a kitchen, the bed were comfortable, and cleaned daily. It was enough for two people. We had a blast because we rented a car and drove everywhere. It was quiet, no one bothered us. Every morning I got a plastic bag to get the complimentary breakfast. The staff members were helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Hope you have a good Chiropractor”
Reviews.Author: Gulleymusic
Reviews.Content: Every TownePlace (we learned the hard way) has their TVs to the sides of the bed and I mean SIDE. Attempts to move it are fruitless as the cable is too short. Even the living area TV is to the side of the couch. Who watches TV like this? The rest of the place was dirty and smelly: Hallways on ground level and 2nd floor, elevator. Our one bedroom was no better: leftover peanut on floor, toilet handle broken, shower curtain chains off, refrig stuck out of the counter because it did not fit under the cabinet (must have been a sale they could not resist and were stupid enough not to measure for, or too lazy to trim the wood.) Never again, not here not to any TownePlace.

Reviews.Title: “My South Beach Alternative. Really!”
Reviews.Author: CactusGary
Reviews.Content: I was on a car trip to Key West and wanted to spend a day at South Beach along the way. After reading many reviews for South Beach and Miami Beach hotels, I came to the conclusion anything affordable was run down, scary or had no parking. Considering I had a car and was a Marriott rewards member, my search turned to hotels further away. This hotel turned out to be a good choice for me. It is convenient to the Dolphin Expressway which goes directly to South Beach. It took me about 20 minutes to get from the hotel to South Beach. I had no problem parking at South Beach either Saturday evening or Sunday morning. Both days I parked at the end of South Pointe Drive which is steps from the beach. Back at TownePlace, parking wasn't a problem. The best part of my stay was the bed. It was awesome. The mattress was plush and the sheets felt high quality. I didn't spend a lot of time in the room so the kitchenette didn't matter. The bathroom was large and very clean. The television was an old 27 inch tube TV which was adequate while getting ready for bed. The remote was missing a battery but the desk clerk replaced it right away. There's a small-ish rectangular swimming pool which might be good to cool off but I didn't use it. Maybe I was lucky but the room was quiet and there were no cooking smells. Overall the room and property were clean, stylish and didn't seem worn or run down like other reviews state. I can see the hotel is meant for business people on extended stays but it worked for my needs, which was a place to sleep while I went to South Beach. I wouldn't make it a vacation destination, it's in a office/commercial area, but I'd stay there again for one or two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible spot!”
Reviews.Author: InspGadget113
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our cruise for 2 nights. The rooms are in very poor condition. Old decor and the appliances are very old as well. Our microwave oven did not work. The free breakfast is in the main lobby, not much bigger than a bedroom. The swimming pool was filthy. We will certainly not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't deserve to be called a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: JanBergeron
Reviews.Content: Outdated, seedy, very well worn. Staff was pleasant and accommodating, but that couldn't make up for all the deficiencies. Supposed to be nonsmoking but reeked of cigarette smoke. Poor excuse for a breakfast, even a "continental" one. Practically no water pressure in shower, had to wait 5-10 minutes to get hot water. I could go on, but why waste time typing. Just avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing stay, wow does this need an update!”
Reviews.Author: Joellens
Reviews.Content: stayed one nite before traveling on, what a disappointment, paid 100 for a studio suite, hard to find parking, hard to find entry to building and then no signs for elevators or location of room. got there, was disappointed further by small cheaply outfitted room, collection of mismatched dishes and a Large hole in bottom of freezer, (how does that happen) Had trouble with shower promptly taken care of by nice staff member. Desk chair and free wi-fi best part of stay. won't ever be going back and have written to Marriot as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, in the middle of nowhere...”
Reviews.Author: Siena99
Reviews.Content: Needing a place to stay after our cruise, I found the TownePlace Suites to be a reasonably priced option. Good size rooms with a small kitchen, but nothing spectacular. Beds were relatively comfortable and clean, but the complimentary breakfast was small and cramped in the lobby of the check-in area. Nice pool, but placed outside the hotel right in the middle of the parking lot. Speaking of location, the hotel is in the middle of an industrial park in the middle of nowhere. If you're looking for a hotel near the action, skip this one. If you're looking for a good value near the airport, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one night but small and outdated room”
Reviews.Author: Scholartime
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our two daughters and we needed a place close to Miami Airport on our last night. We chose this hotel because we needed sleeping room for four and a fridge. It actually had a full kitchen, which more than met our needs, and it would be great for those with children in the nearby hospital. In fact, this hospital caters to those individuals, not necessarily to travelers. The sofa sleeper was disappointingly small, maybe a double, with a pretty bad mattress. The girls ended up putting it on the floor and that was only slightly more comfortable. We had to walk to the reception area to get linens for the mattress and they didnâ€™t fit. Getting to the rooms are inconvenient. The entrance to the building is a long way from the elevator/stairs. Once inside, you have to pass by lots of peopleâ€™s rooms in order to get to the elevator then, once up on your floor, you have to walk back down the hall to your room. You could potentially disturb two full floors of guests on your way to your room, unless you want a room right by the elevator, which would be noisy. We thought the room dÃ©cor was pretty bad. The carpet was especially dirty and outdated. We did not try eating or shopping in the surrounding neighborhood, so I cannot comment on that. In all, for the price, it wasnâ€™t a bad hotel for a one-night stay. I would not want to stay for an extended period of time. The staff was friendly and helpful and did a good job despite the on-going renovations. The breakfast was okay.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: i5405
Reviews.Content: What a dump. If this was a 2 star $30 night hotel then I would know what to expect. Instead the pictures on the web-site as well as the generous room size of 700 square feet made it look nice. Our party had 3 rooms and we were disappointed. The staff was quite helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “We were wondering about the maid service while here...otherwise OK.”
Reviews.Author: earmark72
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here to cut down on the expense of staying onear the water in the Miami/Everglades region. The place is tucked inside an industrial park area near a branch of Miami Children's Hospital in Doral and is quite attractive, but something did not set right about this place as compared to other TP Suites I have been to. 1) I did not see one maid while there ( four days). Our beds were made daily, but not in a manner that indicated care, and our regular coffee was not replaced after the second night - simple stuff but the devil is in the details! 2) The breakfast is not good for anyone on a low sugar diet. All they had was muffins, juice, and nutrigrain bars, with a few pieces of fruit. Very little protein. Petty complaints aside, the desk staff was cheerful and the location is a 30-40 minute drive to many locations in the greater Miami region, in a safe, if boring , area. There are so many worse places to stay; but compared to other TP Suites, it was not as good.

Reviews.Title: “great decent hotel for budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: greenight
Reviews.Content: I and my wife spent 3 nights in this hotel. You have to have a car with you or you won't be able to do anything in this hotel. This hotel is located in the 'west airport' area, in which there's nothing to see. But if you have a car you can access anywhere in Miami area within 30 minutes including everglades national park. This hotel does not provide airport shuttle service. We didn't like the smell when we entered the hallway, but room was a bit spacious and ok. Hotel was in the quiet area, we couldn't hear any airport noise at all. Air conditioner worked very well but water came out from air conditioner and soaked the carpet around it. I had to cover the floor with a towel so that my feet doesn't get wet! Pool was very small and it looked like just for kid's. Hotel provides free wireless internet. I did bidding on priceline.com and got this hotel with very cheap price, so I don't have much complains. It was nice and decent hotel, next time I want to visit hotels around beach even if I will have to pay some more.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for our purpose - maybe yours, but certainly not a resort”
Reviews.Author: gails09
Reviews.Content: Needed a place to stay for 2 nights prior to cruise - and wanted 2 bedrooms. One night occupants were my 80 year old mother, my brother and me. Second night mother, me and teenage daughter and friend. Pretty location not important to us - and that was a good thing, because this hotel is near nothing - there are some strip malls and actually a small cow pasture across the street. Despite "Airport" in name, it is actually at least a 15 minute drive to airport. Hotel is 2 parallel buildings with tiny pool overlooking parking lot. Suite was a real suite - 2 bedrooms with doors and full walls - each with a double or queen bed, a living room with full sized sofa bed, and a fully equipped kitchen, including d/w and m/w. Bathroom was small but adequate, with sink outside. Everything was clean and well maintained. Elevator to 4 floors. Check-in was easy and we were given a choice of room locations. They provide a "Grab and Go" breakfast bag which we did not try and there is coffee in lobby (as well as coffee maker in room). A little confused about housekeeping services - they advertised limited housekeeping (alternate days), but we were there only 2 nights and room was fully cleaned between nights. Really nice mall with decent non-chain restaurants about 4 miles away, as well as usual fast food places within walking distance. A perfectly fine place to stay if you need the space or facilities, don't care about location, and are just looking for a place to sleep at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home- Miami”
Reviews.Author: Canuckgirl
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here over the Xmas holidays in 2008 for 6 nights. We chose this location for its value for the Miami Area. Located about 10 mins from the Miami Airport a few grocery stores are near by such as Publix and Winn Dixie(NW41st/Doral Blvd). Close by (driving distance) restaurants are Applebee's, Pollo Tropical, Tony Romas (NW87th Ave) , Red Losbter, Pizza hut ect.. A very small plaza is located next door has limited choices in retail/shopping. Amenities BBQ for guest to use. Ample parking available on site. Also, small pool with limited chairs. Laudromat in lobby area available $1 per load of wash or dry- Dispensing ($) machine for laundry soap in laundry room). Also, a computer with internet was available to all guest at n/c if you needed to quickly print out your boarding pass, check your e-mail, the weather or touch base with home for a while. This was very valuable and useful to us. Accomodations We had 2 Bedroom unit on the first floor, each BDR with one queen bed and TV. Although the unit was not as large as other 2 BR condo-hotel we stayed at before, it was very comfortable. 2 BR and 1 Sofa bed in the living room fitted our family (4 adults and one teen) needs just fine. In room Kitchen/Dining room Small kitchen with basic pots and pans did the trick. Had a dishwasher, large fridge, stove and microwave . Had to ask front desk regularly to provide dishwasher soap to us. They obliged with every request we had. Lobby has continental breakfast n/c every day, fresh fruits (banana/apple), juices, muffins, granola bars ect. The dining table only had 2 chairs-my only pet peeve of this hotel. Also, note that housekeeping was not offered on a daily basis. They had 2 partial cleaning (providing fresh towels) and one full cleaning during our stay. If you are looking for full service cleaning- I suggest staying at the Marriott's Villas at Doral. Overall, this hotel has a very nice outside apperance and landscape and is very is well maintained. Equally comfortable inside, I think this hotel makes it a great value for the Miami Area stay for families. It is a little far from the beaches about 15-20 mins drive but much worth the extra drive for the value it provides. It's a good choice for people and families who wants to save on fancy hotels and want to cook some of their meals without spending a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly for long term stays - very homey”
Reviews.Author: DX-Traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is decidedly for longer stays and everything is very apartment-like rather than hotel-like. For example, there is no actual "front desk" in the traditional sense - you walk in to an office and check in. It also does not have a restaurant. Each room has a kitchen with full size fridge, stove, dish washer, microwave oven, dishes, pots and pans etc. The bathroom is very nice and homey with wooden floor. Rooms were very clean and furniture and bed in excellent condition. The TV is old style CRT. A/C works well. Breakfast is really not available, you can pick up a couple of boxes of cornflakes and a milk if you like (free). There are tons of restaurants in the neighborhood where good breakfasts can be had. The hotel is excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “So so suite hotel”
Reviews.Author: al3g
Reviews.Content: This suite hotel was mediocre compared to competitors. We got a 2-bedroom suite and found that the suite could be more spacious in every way. Both bedrooms, closets, bathroom, living room and kitchen were pretty small. The hotel was clean, but furniture/beds were just ok. Complimentary breakfast was a joke, they just had some pastries in a basket at the lobby, with a coffee machine nearby. Service at the lobby was slow. Self-service laundromat was typical for the 'hood. The hotel location is out of the way on the western end of Miami. Not much to do as it's located in an industrial area. There are some restaurants nearby, but nothing to brag about. This hotel is ok for a place to crash when traveling on a budget. There are better values to be found in Miami though.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: planegirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night after cruise. A little hard to find. Very friendly staff. We arrived early and the studio room we had booked was not ready, but she upgraded us to a one bedroom suite at no extra charge. Although some of the furnishings were a little worn looking, everything was clean. Very comfortable bed. Had everything that we needed.

Reviews.Title: “It worked well enough”
Reviews.Author: moodyblue
Reviews.Content: I recently finished a 12 night stay at the Towneplace Suites. I was in Miami for business and was not interested nor had the time for even thinking of leisure activities. The bottom line is that it got the job done at a very competitive price. Yes, there is limited housekeeping, but I knew that in advance and wasn't a problem for me. Heck, I normally cancel houskeeeping when I stay in full service hotels - so this was no big deal. The kitchen appliances are pretty cheap, but then I'm not living there. The room shows some wear and tear and when housekeeping does show up, they don't do the best job. I found credit card receipts and various types of hair in dresser drawers when I checked into the room. The complimentary breakfast is fine, if you like opening cellophane wrapped pastries. It's free though, so I won't knock it. I never ate it, but it's there. I guess for me since I was there on business, I wasn't looking for anything more than this place offered. To be there on vacation would be a bit depressing. The surrounding area is light industrial. My room overlooked a loading dock of a warehouse. I was surprised that it was pretty quiet in the evenings. The only problem I did have was people hanging out at the swimming pool late at night (midnight). That happened a couple of nights I was there. You are under the flight path for planes in/outbound from MIA, but at least it's not too bad after 10 pm or so. I can't say I felt great about staying there. I like to be pampered a bit - even if I"m there for business. This is the anti-pamper hotel. But again, it delivered what I wanted and I had a rate of $139 for a double bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Third time around and still loving it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went back to this hotel for an even longer stay. June 1 thru June 18. As per usual, everything was fine..cleaning staff is friendly and efficient and the front office staff is great, Donna Gallant and Hector Soto head up a great team of caring individuals who not only remember you, but treat you like family. One small observation is that no one could tell me me about the bus schedule to Dolphin Mall which is right down the street. Turns out the bus runs every hour or so from practically right in front of the hotel! One tip..if for any reason you don't have you laptop or internet is down..head over to the Best Western right behind the hotel, they are super nice and will allow you to check your mail for free in their business centre. I would not hesitate to use this hotel again..in fact once my business takes me to Miami I will definitely call this hotel "home".

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: mainsail4
Reviews.Content: Don't be tempted by the low price. I was and I suffered for it. I stayed here Feb 1-5,2005 and I was very disappointed by this hotel. Based on this experience I would be hesitant to stay at any TownePlace. The list of problems: 1. I called for directions to the hotel from MIA airport (given the location a question they must get all the time). The person I spoke with was not a native english speaker. When I wanted to get more detail, and asked a follow-up question, she just kept repeating the original directions like she was reading from a script (maybe she was?). 2. Wireless Internet Access in the hotel is horrid. It would drop every 5 minutes and then come back on after 1 minute. If you expect to get work done, don't. 3. Paper thin walls. The people in the unit next to me tended to come in at 1a and I was woken up every night. This was not because they were being particullarly loud, their speaking volume was not loud but, I could hear them like they were in my room because the walls are so thin. 4. Room cleaning. Apparently the rooms are not serviced every day. This is not something that you find out until you are there. Maybe that is my fault for not checking ahead. But, when I called to find out what the cleaning schedule would be, no one at the check-in could tell me. 5. On Fri. night at about 7p the fire alarm went off. It continued for about 5 minutes and then stopped. After about 1 minute it went off again. When staff was contacted to find out what was happening the response was 'we have no idea'. For tunately I was on my way out to dinner so, after ascertaining that the hotel was not actually on fire, I left. By the time I got back later that night the problem was apparently solved. Although the staff couldn't tell me what was wrong just that it was 'fixed now'. Again, and in summary, unless you are a glutton for punishment, or really can't afford a few more $$ per night, don't stay here.

HotelInfo.Name: TownePlace Suites Miami Airport West / Doral Area
HotelInfo.Address: 10505 NW 36th Street, Miami, FL 33178
